sources.paragraph: Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate is believed to be his primary residence, however, it's not the only home on his property portfolio. From 1983 until 2019, his main home was the three-level penthouse on the top floor of Trump Tower in Manhattan. However, in 2019, he named the Palm Beach estate his primary residence.

sources.paragraph: FILE - President Donald Trump speaks to members of the media following a Christmas Eve video teleconference with members of the military at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Fla., Tuesday, Dec. 24, 2019. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik, File)

sources.paragraph: In 2019 Trump declared Mar-a-Lago his primary residence, and in January 2021 he returned there to live full-time after his presidency. His permanent residence was contested by some of his Palm Beach neighbours on the basis of a 1993 zoning agreement stating that guests of the club cannot stay longer than three weeks in one year. However, later in 2021 a court granted Trump permission to live there because club employees were allowed to live on the premises and Trump was considered to be a “bona fide employee.”
